Comments_List: I took on an independent project that led to me learning many concepts in statistics and computer science, as well as more general things such as what it is like to work on a research project that itself is part of a large overarching project in a research lab rather than a smaller, single, independent research project under a faculty advisor.
We literally did not have a class. The DUS was out of the country the entire semester.

The course is great for what it is; it is very much an independent research course so while the class itself is very hands-off, those who make the most of the course will find a lot of value in their work and working with their lab / advisors.
I wish we had a professor.
there was no guidance from the DUS and while the major is dispersed among interests we needed an actual project sheet actual deadlines and actual standards
I'm assuming students considering taking this course are either doing it to finish their major or to conduct independent research for credit. For both of these courses, this class is great.
If you have to take it, take it. I hope you have a professor who is helpful.
You have to take it, but get an advisor who will engage.
